features: ⏩ DURABLE MECHANICAL SWITCHES: The GK61SE is fitted with high-quality, soldered mechanical switches for ultimate reliability and performance, engineered for long-term intensive use.
⏩ RGB: The multicolor RGB lighting system features 16.8 million colors that can be customised into twenty sets of mesmerizing backlight patterns using the software.
⏩Tactile: for tactile responsive typing and gaming ; used by some of the world's best gamers
⏩ DETACHABLE TYPE-C CABLE: Comes with a 5FT/1.5M Type-C to Type-A USB cable that's removable for convenience and portability, ensuring a reliable connection with your devices.
⏩ LUBRICATED STABILIZERS: Pre-lubed stabilizers ensuring minimal wire rattle and solid gaming experience
⏩ SOFTWARE: set up complex macros or rebind keys as you wish and customize lighting effects
⏩ DOUBLESHOT KEYCAPS: Long-lasting, resistant, ultra-sharp legend keycaps in OEM Profile, perfect for typing and gaming, the best of both worlds.
⏩ HIGH-SPEED 1kHz POLLING RATE: Delivering a swift 1ms response time, the GK 61 guarantees precision and quick input registration in fast-paced gaming scenarios.

⏩ Compatibility with Mac and Windows; Compatible with Windows 10, Win 8, Win 7, Win Vista, Windows XP and Mac OS (Might need to remap some key through the software) ; The keyboard is adapted for all environment, Home & Office use.
⏩ KEYPULLER: Keycap puller / Removal tool included to change your key caps on the go or at a esport tournament.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: The Geeky GK61 SE (Standard Edition) is a mechanical gaming keyboard featuring soldered switches, customizable RGB lighting, and a detachable Type-C cable. Designed for performance and aesthetics, it's compatible with various operating systems and provides a robust gaming and typing experience.

Technical Specifications Manufacturer Geeky Model Name GK61 SE (Standard Edition) Layout ANSI - US ( QWERTY) Form Factor 60% ( 61 keys) PCB Soldered Mechanical Key Switches ( NOT Hotswappable) Frame Material ABS Keycaps Material ABS Keycaps Printing Method Doubleshot Keycaps Profile OEM Profile Cable length 1.5 m (5.2 ft) Dimensions 14.8 x 5.2 x 0.9 in (290 x 102 x 40 mm) Inclination 6° Weight 1.3 lbs (0.6 kg)

Exploded View The Geeky GK61 SE keyboard is equipped with soldered switches. While it doesn't offer hotswappable capabilities, it is designed for durability and a stable typing experience tailored to your needs.

Function layer The GK61's Function layer enhances usability by pressing FN, granting access to arrow keys, multimedia controls, lighting adjustments, and various keys like print screen, home, page up, and page down. It's a convenient feature for streamlined control and navigation.

Can I customize the switches on the Geeky GK61 SE? Is it hotswap? No, the Geeky GK61 SE does not feature hotswap capabilities. It comes with soldered switches. The PCB supports both 3-pin and 5-pin mechanical switches, but customization would require desoldering and soldering. What kind of lighting effects does this keyboard offer? The Geeky GK61 SE features a multicolor RGB lighting system with 16.8 million customizable colors. You can create twenty sets of mesmerizing backlight patterns using the provided software, giving you endless options to match your style or mood. What is the polling rate of the Geeky GK61SE, and why does it matter for gaming? The Geeky GK61 SE boasts a high-speed 1kHz polling rate, delivering a swift 1ms response time. This ensures precision and quick input registration, vital for fast-paced gaming scenarios. Is the Geeky GK61 SE compatible with Windows, Mac, and gaming consoles like PS4, PS5, and XBOX? Yes, the Geeky GK61 SE works with Windows 10, Win 8, Win 7, Win Vista, Windows XP, and Mac OS. It's also compatible with PS4, PS5, and XBOX. Some keys may need remapping for Mac, but it's adaptable for home, office, or gaming environments. What's the difference between Black, Blue, Brown, Red, Speed Yellow, and Speed Silver switches? Brown switches are versatile, good for typing & gaming. Speed Yellow & Speed Silver are ultra-fast, designed for gaming. Red switches are gaming-specific, with a linear feel. Black has higher resistance, and Blue is tactile & clicky.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars FN ~ key combo not working
reviews.reviewText: the keyboard itself is fine. i used it to play rhythm games (its superb for this) and some other games that require fast and frame perfect inputs. biggest issue i have is when using the function key combo for the tilde key. when i Fn + Left Shift + Esc it types ` and not ~. i found a simple work around using the GK Utility software, that the manual inside says to download, but the fact that i have to do that at all is annoying. even then when u do that u lose access to ` instead and can only type ~.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 10, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good Compact Wired KB Option
reviews.reviewText: WHAT’S INCLUDED:-Geeky GK61 Keyboard-Keycap Puller-USB-C to A cable-Quickstart GuidePRODUCT:This Review is for the Geeky GK61 60% keyboard. This keyboard comes in multiple switch types. This review is for the BLUE clicky switches. It is a wired Keyboard powered by a USB-C to USB-A CableYou have 61 keys max, which gives you a compact style designThere are no foot adjustments, but the KB itself has a moderate slope to accommodate the lack of that.Keys:Since this is a 60% keyboard you will have some reduction in space between keys, and certain keys will be cut down on their overall size such as your CTRL..etc However, most of the keys are still easy to type on and they are pretty standard keycap size. Images are included to show you. Measuring about 17.1mm wide and 11.3mm tall.RGB:The RGB lighting on this keyboard is backlighting and on the keycaps. It is NOT set lighting. It is dynamic, and all types of colors can be displayed in all zones on this keyboard.Software:Geeky Does provide software for this keyboard that you need to download from their website. The information is listed in the quickstart guide. I highly recommend you follow this so you can get software control over the KB. However, it is optional and if you want to control the lighting functions via key combinations only, you can do that as well.With the software, it’s broken into 3 main tabsKey AssignmentLightingMacroYou also have your profile selector at the bottom. You can save up to 3 profiles.-key assignment:you can set your custom key functions. Keystrokes, Macros, Set a multimedia key. It’s VERY customizable.-Lighting:You have 20 lighting modes to choose from including off. You can set the Brightness on every lighting mode, and adjust the speed on most lighting modes if it applies to that type. Some modes also require a color selection.-Macro:Your final section is a macro setup where you can record macros. Back on your key assignment area, you can then apply that macro to the keys you want.FINAL THOUGHTS:I got the blue switches which are VERY clickly. This isn’t good or bad, it’s simply preference. This is just something you need to be aware of. I’m primarily a red switch user as I feel like that color offers the most well-balanced setup.-The keycap texture is a little gritty feeling. I notice this a lot on more inexpensive keyboards. It’s not too bad though.-The size of most of your regular keycaps is pretty standard and I found them comfortable to use. I even was able to swap out my keys from one of my big name-brand KBs and they had no trouble fitting on each other, and the size of the Keycaps felt very at home. I’ve added some pictures so you can see the millimeter size of a regular keycap.-I didn’t notice any ghosting issues in all of my typing, which was quite extensive.-I only did some short gaming sessions, but again my performance was just fine. It felt like any other higher-end Blue switch keyboard. This is great considering this is a more low-cost solution-The RGB lighting is very vibrant, and since you get quite a lot of lighting options to choose from, you should find one that works for you.-Having software control is BIG BONUS. I can’t tell you how many keyboards I’ve tested that don’t offer software. Everything is hardware-based. And while that might be fine for a lot of people, it always works best when you have the option for software control if you want it.-This model comes in quite a bit of switch options. Blue, Red, Silver, Black, and Brown. That’s good news for such a lesser-priced keyboard. Anyone can pick the switch option that works for them.I think this is a great portable KB option. I kind of wish it had a battery as well, but that would also affect the pricing no doubt. However, even only being a wired board, it’s still quite good with lots of lighting and switch options. Full macro abilities. Software control support. I think if you want a wired compact option, this might be for you. Just research the switch type you think you’d like if you are not used to mechanical keyboards, and pick the one that sounds right for you.

The media could not be loaded. I changed the keycaps to fit my setup a bit more, but i’m loving this keyboard! I got the speed silver switches. They’re a bit touchy but eventually you’ll get used to them and they’re not super loud like most cheap keyboards. I love it! The only thing that I would change about this keyboard is it unfortunately doesn’t have a solid colour option so the RGB is just rainbow.
